p.span: Here is a photo of one of our meal bags that include a breakfast, lunch and dinner for children that are 18 years or younger at Magnet Cove School District. Food pickup times are from 11:00am until 1:00pm and delivery is available upon request within the district by calling 501.337.9131. As of today, we have served 17,198 meals since Governor Hutchinson closed the district and initiated AMI days. By this Thursday we will have hit the 20,000 meal mark. Special thanks to Chef Billy Phillips, cafeteria workers, employees, Food Center, Family Market, administration and board members for working, volunteering, and donationing to make this effort a success
Areas marked on the map are where vehicles can go to and use FREE WIFI on BYOD(Bring your own

img.span: Device) network. Attach to “Safe Learning Zone”, no password needed.

p.span: MORE FREE WIFI The Cove (store across from the school) also now has a HOT SPOT Sponsored by Hot Springs County Library. The password is 40725539.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.38; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.38; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

hr.p: The elementary library was thrilled to check out many books to students just before we began the AMI days. It was our hope that students would have books to read in the event of a school closure for a week or so. Since our time has been extended, feel free to drop off your child's library books at the high school under the awning with the AMI work in the box labeled "Elementary" as they finish reading. Thank you so much for supporting literacy during this time! Please contact Mrs. Eskola at eskolal@magnetcove.k12.ar.us if you need access to free ebooks at home.

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

hr.p: Governor Hutchinson announced during his press conference last week that schools will remain closed for in school instruction for the remainder of the school year.
Students will continue to complete AR AMI packets in grades K-8 through May 1st and then will be implementing a similar AMI plan for the remainder of the school year.

Students in grades 9 through 11 will continue to complete math, English, science and social studies lessons through Virtual Arkansas. All students in grades 9 through 11 have been signed up for Virtual Arkansas and teachers should be in contact with students to provide assistance as needed.

The district will continue to prepare AMI packets each week and will post them on the district’’s website or teachers’ Google Classroom pages. For those without internet, the district will have copies of those AMI packets for pickup at the following locations for grades K-8: the HS drive through, The Cove Store; or Diamond Joes. For parents unable to pick up the packets, call the school's building secretary to make arrangements with the District for delivery. In grades 9-11, packets have to be individualized based on student schedules, therefore if you need a paper packet for grades 9-11 please contact the High School Office.
As appropriate, more detailed information will be provided via the school website, Facebook and school messenger. If you have any questions, please email your child’s teacher.

br.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

span.b: The Magnet Cove School District is serving free meals for pickup daily from 11:00am to 1:00pm

under the high school awning. Meals include breakfast, lunch and dinner. Meals are also being delivered to those unable to access meals at the school due to lack of transportation. In order to accommodate those needing delivery, there are two options for submitting orders. Orders can be submitted by calling 501-337-9131 or by submitting orders via a Google form located on the homepage of the Magnet Cove School District website. Phone orders will be accepted between 8 and 10 am. If utilizing the Google form, orders must be submitted by 10am. Deliveries will begin at 11:30 am to the address provided. Please be visible at the address you submit on the Google form or provide via phone. Any bus riders, please be visible at your normal bus stop.

p.span: Please fill out the following form to have lunch delivered to your home : https://forms.gle/Kwm25kjLxtmUjw4b9

u.span: **If you student has food allergies, please speak to the Chartwells empolyee when meals are delivered or picked up for more information**

hr.p: Governor’s Media Contact: Press Shop (press@governor.arkansas.gov or 501.683.3642)
If you have questions or concerns about COVID-19, you can contact the Arkansas Department of Health at 800.803.7847 or visit https://www.healthy.arkansas.gov/.

div.class: custom_127023 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.b: Due to the current situation with COVID-19, Magnet Cove kindergarten registration will no longer be held on April 3. Please fill out the Google form that will allow you to register your upcoming kindergarten student. To receive a packet via USPS, please call 501-337-9131 Monday-Friday from 8:00-3:00. If your child was a student in Headstart or ABC PreK, you will be receiving a registration packet in the mail. For any questions, please call 501-337-9131.
Thank you! KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION GOOGLE FORM

span.span: This is a public announcement. Public School Choice in Arkansas allows students to attend a public school in a district other than the one in which they reside. Applications for students in the following counties: Clark, Grant, Hot Spring, Pike, and Saline, (must be made by May 1, 2020 to qualify for provisions under the Arkansas Public School Choice Act of 2013.)

div.p: Pursuant to standards adopted by a non-resident school board, a non-resident district may reserve the right to accept and reject applicants based on capacity of programs, class, grade level, or school building. Likewise, a non-resident district’s standards may provide for the rejection of an applicant based upon the submission of false or misleading information to the above listed request for information when that information directly impacts the legal qualifications of an applicant to transfer pursuant to the School Choice Act. However, a non-resident district’s standards shall not include an applicant’s previous academic achievement, athletic or other extra-curricular ability, handicapping conditions, English proficiency level, or previous disciplinary proceedings, except that an expulsion from another district may be included pursuant to Ark. Code Ann. 6-18-510. Priority will be given to applicants with siblings attending the district. The non-resident district shall accept credits toward graduation that were awarded by another district and award a diploma to a non-resident applicant if the applicant meets the non-resident district’s graduation requirements. Applications must be postmarked or delivered to the Superintendent of Schools no later than May 1 for a child to be able to enroll for the fall semester. Transfers shall be granted on a non-discriminatory basis. Students who have been accepted and enrolled in previous years do not have to reapply as approved transfers remain valid for as long as the student attends that public school. SCHOOL CHOICE APPLICATION​
